meanings.definition: Not open to more than one interpretation; clear.
meanings.sent1: The instructions were nonambiguous, leaving no room for confusion.
meanings.sent2: The nonambiguous answer to the math problem was 5.
meanings.sent3: The nonambiguous sign on the door made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her nonambiguous refusal echoed in his mind like a clear bell.
meanings.sent5: The nonambiguous red stop sign stood out boldly against the white background.

meanings.sent1: The nonambiguous rules of the game were easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: His nonambiguous decision to resign surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The nonambiguous recipe for disaster made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The nonambiguous truth hit him like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The nonambiguous blue sky stretched endlessly above them.
